block.comment:
UP Aerospace data demonstration
FE simulator demo UART in, USB Out RECEIVE data from the Future Engineers simulator over UART (RX pin) ECHO (PRINT) the data back to the serial monitor (USB)
SHOW current status based on event string with neopixels
Requires a USB to TTL (UART) device like this USB to TTL Serial Cable: https://www.adafruit.com/product/954
Connect the Tx wire (green wire on the USB to TTL Serial cable) to the RX pad on the Circuit Playground Express Connect the Ground wire (black wire on the USB to TTL Serial cable) to the GND (ground) pad on the Circuit Playground Express
# Declare FE_sim_data object, provider argument must be supplied: sim_data = FE_sim_data.FESimData(provider='up_aerospace')
# at the top of the loop, run the update() method for the FE_sim_data object sim_data.update()
# check if the data is currently streaming... if sim_data.streaming:
if sim_data.new_data: # print the data to the serial monitor print(sim_data.data) # print the event to the serial monitor print(sim_data.event)
Written by Arnold Martin for Future Engineers

SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2021 Future Engineers LLC
SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
setup FE_sim_data object for up aerospace rocket flight

shadow.field: 'LIFTOFF BURNOUT DESPIN GRAVSTART SEPARATION GRAVEND DROGUE MAIN'

block.comment: read the serial data from FE_sim_data object
events arrive as a continuous string LIFTOFF BURNOUT DESPIN GRAVSTART SEPARATION GRAVEND DROGUE MAIN'
if statement to check for change in the event data
check that it is a good event and not bad DATA
if...elif responding to up_aerospace event data

shadow.field: Main chute deployed, floating gently to Earth
Booster is burning, we have liftoff

block.comment: sleep for a bit to prevent data overflow in MU
